answers.answer: Hi,I have had 2 diabetic pregnancies.  Both successful.First thing is you should have your blood sugar under excellent control before getting pregnant.Once pregnant you will need to monitor your blood sugars very carefully and frequently, and increase or decrease your insulin as required.You will be monitored closely by your medical team.I also ate low carb, which helped a lot in blood sugar management.

Here is some information on diabetes and pregnancy for you, from MedHelp.org and the Sugar Sense app. Congratulations to you and best wishes for a healthy pregnancy!http://www.medhelp.org/diabetes/articles/A-Safe-Pregnancy-with-Diabetes/1754http://www.medhelp.org/diabetes/articles/Pregnant-with-Diabetes/1755You can find these in the Stay Well category of the Health Guide (which is available from the menu in the upper left of the home screen).
